definition: to be picky (food)
to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]
to eat/food/animal feed/eclipse
to feed (a person or animal)
when hungry, you can't pick what you eat (idiom); beggars can't be choosers/When matters are urgent, don't spend time choosing alternatives.
to choose one's food carefully/to be picky

sentences.english: The dearth of returning migrants set off a desperate scramble this week to recruit workers.
sentences.chinese: 返城民工的短缺使得這周的招募工人變得飢不擇食。

sentences.english: The moose probably did what she did because she was desperate for food.
sentences.chinese: 很可能是由於飢餓，它才這麼飢不擇食的。

sentences.english: Indiscriminate eaters, Amazon horned frogs can grow to about the size of a small plate.
sentences.chinese: 飢不擇食的亞馬遜角蛙能長到一個小盤子那麼大。

definition: to get angry
gluttonous/ravenous
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself
well-tried/time-tested
official authority used for private interests (idiom); to attain private ends by abusing public position
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
to both be willing/mutual consent
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
to harm others/to mock people/to taunt/humiliating
lit. the whip cannot reach (idiom); beyond one's influence/too far to be able to help
to digress/to stray from the subject
to bear grudges
to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
to have good luck/lucky/in luck
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
